edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.commitmentScheme
Interface CmtWithProofsReceiver

All Superinterfaces:
CmtReceiver
All Known Implementing Classes:
CmtElGamalWithProofsReceiver, CmtPedersenWithProofsReceiver
public interface CmtWithProofsReceiver
extends CmtReceiver

This interface is used by the verifier to verify that:

1. The committer knows the committed value.

2. The committed value was x.

All commitment scheme that have proofs should implement this interface.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

                               java.io.IOException,
                               CheatAttemptException
Verifies that the committer knows the committed value.

Parameters:
id - of the commitment message.

CheatAttemptException - if there is an error that could have been caused by a cheating attempt

verifyCommittedValue

CmtCommitValue verifyCommittedValue(long id)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                           CheatAttemptException,
                                           CommitValueException
Verifies that the committed value with the given id was x.

Parameters:
id - of the committed value.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is any problem at the communication level
CommitValueException - if the commit value does not match the implementing commitment
CheatAttemptException - if there is an error that could have been caused by a cheating attempt
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the decommitment received cannot be deserialized
